definition: to be beaten/to take a drubbing/buffeted/knocked about
to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle
to beat up/to break to pieces

sentences.english: You don't want that to happen, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你不想让我们挨揍，是吧？

sentences.english: Being minimumally familiar with boxing and muaythai may save your skin someday.
sentences.chinese: 稍微熟悉一下拳击和泰拳可能会在某天让你免于挨揍。

sentences.english: If I were beaten at home, there was absolutely nothing that I could do about it.
sentences.chinese: 我要是在家里挨揍呢，那是干脆一点办法也没有了。

sentences.english: Can you understand the mentality of a kid who had been beaten up before?
sentences.chinese: 你能理解一个曾经挨揍的小孩的心理吗？

sentences.english: You u'll catch it, when your father finds you've been trampling over the flower beds.
sentences.chinese: 要是你父亲发现你踩过花坛，你会挨揍的。

sentences.english: I do not know why, but I often paid for the others.
sentences.chinese: 不知道为什么，我总是挨揍的那个。

sentences.english: If Dad sees you smoking, you'll catch it.
sentences.chinese: 要是爸爸看到你抽烟，你会挨揍的。

sentences.english: Anyone trying to muscle in on the gang's territory would get his face smashed.
sentences.chinese: 谁要想挤进这帮家伙的地盘，谁就会挨揍。

sentences.english: A child who fears beating, would never admit that he played with a missing knife.
sentences.chinese: 害怕挨揍的孩子，绝不会承认刀子是他拿去玩的。

sentences.english: Take a beating, did you have no the thing of dissimilar position?
sentences.chinese: 挨揍，你就没有别的位置的东西了么？

sentences.english: The Clary's Grove boys looked at their beaten leader and turned on Lincoln.
sentences.chinese: 克莱尔小树林的男孩子们看着头儿挨揍，转向林肯。

sentences.english: Spanking in childhood also has been related to criminality.
sentences.chinese: 童年挨揍也跟犯罪有关联。

definition: to take a beating/to get thrashed/to come under attack
to beat up/to break to pieces
to fight/to scuffle/to come to blows/CL:場|场[chang2]
to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle
a bloody nose and a swollen face/badly battered
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
(dialect) to come to blows/to have a row
